article_title: Let Medicare Patients Decide Which Accountable Care Organization To Join

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: One loudly trumpeted tool to create value in Medicare is the Accountable Care Organization (ACO). Unfortunately, ACOs are underwhelming and soon likely to fall off the radar screen. The ACO model never fooled the Congressional Budget Office, which estimated that in 2010 they would only save $4.9 billion through 2019 – just 11% of the total cuts to Medicare incorporated within Obamacare. A major problem with ACOs is how the government assigns Medicare beneficiaries to plans. Seniors should be allowed to choose their own ACO.
